title: Do you ever turn your computer off? Why or why not? - Quora

response.answer_text: I turn my computer off when I leave the house and when I go to sleep. I don't see a reason to leave it running all the time. I think my modern computer turns on fast enough that I am not worried about waiting for it to boot. The only time I leave my computer on is when I am downloading something huge or doing a big update.

Back in the day, the standard view of component reliability was the number of on-off cycles it would last. That had a lot to do with the fact that chips were attached to PCBs. Having the temperature go up and down was bad for solder joints. I don’t know if this is still true but I never turn anything off. Old habits…

I turn my PC off when I’m not uploading or downloading files as I can see no point in leaving it on. It saves energy and reduces the risk of a fire. I turn off my netbook before I put it in its case so it doesn’t overheat.
Yes I do… I turn mine off when I go to bed, or when I’m out of the house for more than a few minutes. No point leaving it on, wasting power - when it’s not being used !
